context: acilities between 1970 and 2010. second, the project investigates the political economy of places where new prison facilities are built, including the presence of manufacturing and poverty rates. third, the study investigates the impact of the prison booms and busts on employment, poverty, economic inequality, and health disparities. determinants of prison building are tested using rare event logistic regression. the project trains young researchers from groups underrepresented in stem. the findings inform efforts to support rural communities that are affected by the building and closing of prisons.
